title: Can the Razr Plus *REALLY* crack with a single finger?
description: Time to Durability test a NEW Motorola Razr Plus. Get a 4-week trial, free postage, and a digital scale at  Thanks to Stamps.com for sponsoring the show! We found a void under the screen of the Motorola Razr Plus (Also known as the Razor 40 Ultra outside of the USA) And today we find out if a bit of pressure can destory the new razr plus more easily than a regular phone.   Razr Plus Durability Test video:  Razr Plus Teardown Video:   Get my JerryRig Razor knife HERE:   Follow me for updates!  Instagram:   Facebook:   Twitter:    LARGE tool kit:   Travel Tool Kit:   Mega Tool Kit:   Plastic Pry tools:   Metal phone opening tool:   The camera I used to film this video:  (GH6   The Lens I used for this video:   Wide angle lens:   And this Metabones adapter:   This is the drone I use:    TO SEND ME STUFF: See my P.O. Box on my 'About page':   JerryRigEverything assumes no liability for property damage or injury incurred as a result of any of the information contained in this video. JerryRigEverything recommends safe practices when working with power tools, automotive lifts, lifting tools, jack stands, electrical equipment, blunt instruments, chemicals, lubricants, expensive electronics, or any other tools or equipment seen or implied in this video. Due to factors beyond the control of JerryRigEverything, no information contained in this video shall create any express or implied warranty or guarantee of any particular result. Any injury, damage or loss that may result from improper use of these tools, equipment, or the information contained in this video is the sole responsibility of the user and not JerryRigEverything. Only attempt your own repairs if you can accept personal responsibility for the results, whether they are good or bad.

Now we see if the new Motorola Razr can survive a pinch. Let's get started. [Intro] I wasn't planning on making this video until I saw a comment on the original durability test from someone who had an experience with their phone breaking in a pocket. She says she tucked the Razr Phone Plus into the pocket of her skirt and that pressure alone caused the front screen to crack due to that same cavity under the screen that we discovered during the durability test. She called Motorola and she said it was her fault the screen broke, but if her and I are having the same issue, it might just be a factory defect that more people are going to experience besides just me and her. And today, we're going to definitively find out. Cracking during normal use and normal transportation would indeed be a defect and not user error. And I would hope that if it's true that this does break on a whim that Motorola will take care of their customers. So any pressure applied to the top surface near the center of the phone on the outer screen could crack the display since there's a void underneath and a tiny lip. It looks like there's only a millimeter and a half of real estate up top for that glass to sit on. There's only one way to find out for sure though. Let's start with about 10% pressure right here. I felt something move. Okay, that was about 10%. Not too bad, not too bad. Let's start with 25%. I feel it moving. Okay that was 25%. Let's try 50%. Very interesting. Nothing yet. It might survive. Let's try 75%. Nothing yet. Interesting. This is 100% right here. No crack. No crack. That's very good for Motorola. Alright, let's see if we can do two. No crack. Alright. Nice work, Motorola. Let's try it with the screen open. And Motorola survives. No damage done to that center display...the outer display, no matter how hard I press. Middle screen is still alive. Outer screen is still alive. The Motorola survives. The pressures of the bend test as we were forcing it open is what cracked the display last time, along with my fingers being on that void. Well, there is a void there, but it's not going to accidentally break by itself. At least here on my unit. Very nice. Very nice. I was wrong. I'm glad we were able to satisfy our curiosity and get that question out of our system. I would hope though that if over time Motorola discovers that with normal usage they see more cracked screens than usual, they would still come out and help their customers who might be having those issues. But at least here with us on this singular brand new phone, it does not seem that I will break with normal use out of the box. Carnage doesn't always happen. Anyway, if you have any questions leave them down in the comments. Nice work, Motorola. Thanks a ton for watching. I'll see you around.
